{"topic": "Family tree logic", "question": "Rajesh says, \u201cHe is the only son of my mother\u2019s only daughter.\u201d How is Rajesh related to him?", "choices": ["A) Uncle", "B) Nephew", "C) Cousin", "D) Son"], "answer": "B", "explanation": "Rajesh's mother's only daughter is Rajesh's sister. The only son of Rajesh's sister is Rajesh's nephew. Thus, Rajesh is the nephew's uncle."}

{"topic": "Syllogisms", "question": "Statement I: All books are pens
Statement II: Some pens are pencils
Statement III: All pencils are erasers
Conclusions I: Some erasers are books
Conclusion II: Some pens are erasers", "choices": ["A) If only conclusion II follows", "B) If only conclusion I follows", "C) If conclusion I and II both follow", "D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows"], "answer": "A", "explanation": "Pens are shared between books and pencils, but no direct link ensures some erasers are books. Conclusion II is valid due to overlap."}

{"topic": "Family tree logic", "question": "Rajesh says, \u201cHe is the son of my mother\u2019s only sibling.\u201d How is Rajesh related to him?", "choices": ["A) Nephew", "B) Brother", "C) Cousin", "D) Uncle"], "answer": "C", "explanation": "Rajesh's mother's only sibling is his aunt or uncle. The son of Rajesh's aunt/uncle is his cousin. Therefore, Rajesh is related to him as a cousin."}

{"topic": "Syllogisms", "question": "Statement I: Some fruits are priced at $5
Statement II: All bananas are priced at $5
Statement III: Some bananas are oranges
Conclusion I: Some oranges are priced at $5
Conclusion II: Some fruits are bananas", "choices": ["A) If only conclusion I follows", "B) If only conclusion II follows", "C) If conclusion I and II both follow", "D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows"], "answer": "C", "explanation": "Bananas priced at $5 and some bananas are oranges imply some oranges are priced at $5. Fruits include bananas, confirming conclusion II."}
